intro: Urtica micrantha, commonly known as stinging nettle, is a perennial flowering plant native to various regions across Asia, Africa, and the Americas. It belongs to the Urticaceae family and is characterized by its hollow,螫毛-covered stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. Urtica micrantha is known for its stinging hairs that release irritants when touched, causing a skin reaction in many individuals. Despite its defensive traits, it has been used in traditional medicine and as a food source in some cultures.
